body.p: The IASB reached this conclusion because:

li.p: it considers that separate recognition of goodwill, when present, is preferable to allocating premiums to identifiable assets acquired on the basis of relative fair values;
it thinks that an approach that limits the application of business combinations accounting only to issues that are not addressed elsewhere in IFRS lacks a strong conceptual basis; and

the guidance in IFRS 3 and other IFRSs on business combinations give a comprehensive and consistent set of accounting principles for the different components of such complex transactions as acquisitions of interests in businesses.
